item.title: Orality to writing
item.description: From Orality to Writing: Transmission and Interpretation of Pāṇini’s Aṣṭādhyāyī MADHAV M. DESHPANDE 1. Emergence of writing Emergence of writing in ancient India and Pāṇini’s knowledge and /or use of writing During the last two decades, extensive research has appeared dealing with the origin of scripts in ancient India, and the chief participants in this research, namely Harry FALK, Oskar von HINÜBER, and Richard SALOMON, have not only discussed the question of the origin of Kharoṣṭhī and Brāhmī script, but have also considered available literary references in the ancient Indian literature that have been taken by the various authorities to infer an awareness of the art of writing.
